problem.markdown:
1. Different conformations of the protein differ only in: () distance between the bonds of backbone and amino acid side chains () number of amino acid side-chains (x) angle of rotation about the bonds of backbone and amino acid side-chains () measure of dihedral angle at the peptide
2. Chemical denaturation denotes marked change in protein structure of the native protein in response to: () change in temperature (x) acid or alkali () Disruption of weak interactions by boiling () Exposure to detergents
3. Which of the following chemical denaturant is not an inorganic salt? () Lithium bromide () Potassium thiocyanate (x) Dimethyl Formamide () Sodium iodide
4. What mol/l of Urea acts as a Chaotrophic chemical denaturant? () 7-14 mol/l (x) 6-8 mol/l () 10 -12 mol/l () 2-4 mol/l
5. Acids and bases denature a protein by disrupting: () peptide bonds and ionic bonds () hydrophobic interactions and peptide bonds (x) ionic bonds and hydrogen bonds () amide bonds and alkene bonds () ionic bonds and hydrophobic interactions
6. What kind of interactions are not part of the protein tertiary structure ? () disulphide bonds () hydrophobic interactions () salt bridges () hydrophilic interactions (x)peptide bonds
7. The most important contribution to the stability of a protein's conformation appears to be the: (x) entropy increase from the decrease in ordered water molecules forming a solvent shell around it. () maximum entropy increase from ionic interactions between the ionized amino acids in a protein. () sum of free energies of formation of many weak interactions among the hundreds of amino acids in a protein. () sum of free energies of formation of many weak interactions between its polar amino acids and surrounding water.
8. Which of the following chemical denaturant is a cross-linking reagent? (x) Formaldehyde. () Dimethyl Formamide. () Formamide. () Sodium dodecyl sulphate.
9. An average protein will not be denatured by: () a detergent such as sodium dodecyl sulfate. (x) iodoacetic acid. () heating to 90°C. () urea.
problem.p: 1. Different conformations of the protein differ only in:

choicegroup.choice: distance between the bonds of backbone and amino acid side chains
angle of rotation about the bonds of backbone and amino acid side-chains
measure of dihedral angle at the peptide
